properties.areaDesc: Randolph, IL; Clinton, IL; Bond, IL; Ste. Genevieve, MO; Marion, IL; Reynolds, MO; Madison, MO; Washington, IL; Iron, MO; St. Francois, MO; Fayette, IL
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 7 at 4:03AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
Multiple rounds of rainfall are very likely Thursday through
Saturday morning across the bi-state area. Currently, the heaviest
period of rain along with a few thunderstorms is expected to be
from Friday night into early Saturday morning. By the time the
precipitation ends late Saturday, 1 to 3 inches are expected. The
highest amounts are forecast to be across portions of southeast
Missouri and southwest Illinois where locally higher amounts above
3 inches are possible.

This prolonged period of wet weather will lead to rises on some area
rivers. Renewed river flooding is possible across southeastern
portions of the area, particularly along the Black River in
southeast Missouri and the Kaskaskia River in Illinois. In
addition to the possible river flooding, flash flooding may be
possible Friday night and early Saturday morning due to the
potential for high rainfall rates to fall on already saturated
soils.

Be sure to remain up to date with the latest river forecasts, and
possible warnings, especially if you live along a river or other
flood prone location.

NWSheadline: HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
